Research

We use emerging computational technologies—with a focus on artificial intelligence (AI)—to discover mechanisms underlying diverse human diseases.

Our main areas of clinical interest include:

  • Environmental toxicology: Which diseases are caused by exposure to specific environmental chemicals, and why?
  • Maternal health: How do environmental exposures and other risk factors influence susceptibility to diseases in pregnancy?
  • Autoimmune diseases: Why do some people develop life-threatening autoimmune reactions to emerging cancer immunotherapy drugs?

Software and Resources

We build new knowledge bases and tools for analyzing complex biomedical knetworks. Check the links below to learn about some of these:

  • ComptoxAI – A data infrastructure for AI research in computational toxicology
  • AlzKB – The Alzheimer's Knowledge Base
  • Ista – A semantic toolkit for constructing knowledge graphs using ontologies and publicly available data
